chiprag.postgres_utils package¶

Submodules¶

chiprag.postgres_utils.chi_postgres_store module¶

Collection of functions to send data to and get data from a PostgreSQL database in the context of this somewhat unconventional RAG pipeline.

chiprag.postgres_utils.chi_postgres_store.query_database(keywords: list[str]) → list[str]¶

Queries the database using the provided Connection object. Performs a fuzzy word match for single keywords and an exact ‘ILIKE’ match for keyphrases.

Parameters:

  • user_prompt (str) – Keywords given by the user, split by ‘;’. This is not enforced by code, but is a requirement.

  • conn (Psycopg2 Connection Object) – Connection Object to perform actions with the database.

  • close_conn_afterwards (bool) – Variable to decide whether to close the Connection Object after use. Defaults to True.

Returns:

List of all rows matching the SQL-query.

Return type:

list[str]

chiprag.postgres_utils.chi_postgres_store.upload_dataframe(df: DataFrame) → None¶

Uploads a given DataFrame using a query to a postgreSQL Database. This function is tailored to a Pandas DataFrame with the columns [pesticide, text].

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – The Pandas DataFrame which is to be uploaded.

  • conn (psycopg2 Connection Object) – Connection Object to perform actions with the database.

  • close_conn_afterwards (bool) – Variable to decide whether to close the Connection Object after use. Defaults to True.

Returns:

None

chiprag.postgres_utils.eu_postgres_store module¶

Functions for saving, updating, and retrieving EU DataLake data in a PostgreSQL database.

chiprag.postgres_utils.eu_postgres_store.get_all_pesticides() → list¶

Retrieves a list of all unique pesticides from the PostgreSQL database.

Returns:

All unique pesticide names.

Return type:

list

chiprag.postgres_utils.eu_postgres_store.get_pesticide_data(pesticide_list: list[str]) → dict¶

Fetches all data from the EU DataLake database for specified pesticides.

Parameters:

pesticide_list (list[str]) – List of pesticide names to retrieve data for.

Returns:

Mapping of pesticide names to their full database records.

Return type:

dict

chiprag.postgres_utils.eu_postgres_store.store_pesticide_data(applicable_data: DataFrame, not_yet_applicable_data: DataFrame) → None¶

Stores cleaned EU DataLake data in a PostgreSQL database.

First clears existing entries and resets the ID sequence, then inserts the new applicable data.

Parameters:

  • applicable_data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with applicable entries.

  • include (Must) – pesticide_residue_name, product_name, mrl_value_only, applicability_text, application_date.

  • not_yet_applicable_data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame with not yet applicable entries.

  • include – pesticide_residue_name, product_name, mrl_value_only, applicability_text, application_date.

Returns:

None

chiprag.postgres_utils.util_postgres_store module¶

Utility functions for PostgreSQL in Python, including connecting to the database and querying data.

chiprag.postgres_utils.util_postgres_store.establish_connection() → tuple[connection, cursor]¶

Establishes a connection with a configured PostgreSQL database.

Returns:

A psycopg2 connection object. psycopg2.extensions.cursor: A psycopg2 cursor object.

Return type:

psycopg2.extensions.connection

chiprag.postgres_utils.util_postgres_store.get_data(query: str) → list¶

Executes a simple SQL query without additional parameters.

Parameters:

query (str) – The SQL query to execute.

Returns:

Results returned by the query.

Return type:

list
